title: SpaceX's Starship explosion threatens NASA's moon return
description: The various technical problems revealed after Space X's failed rocket launch could have repercussions for the American lunar program.

title: New Zealand: At least six dead in fire that broke out in Wellington hostel
description: Prime Minister Chris Hipkins described the fire as 'an absolute tragedy' while acknowledging that there are still many more people still unaccounted for.

title: Reindustrialization: 'Whether they admit it or not, European leaders defend national interests first'
description: Europe must find a way to balance joint projects on batteries and semiconductors while preserving its interests in the raging competition within the continent argues journalist Jean-Michel Bezat in his column.

title: Tunisia: Opposition party leader Rached Ghannouchi sentenced to a year in prison
description: Ghannouchi, one of the main opponents of Tunisian President Kais Saied, was charged with terror-related crimes after being accused of calling police officers 'tyrants'.

title: Macron says 'door is open' to train Ukrainian fighter pilots
description: Speaking on French television on Monday, the French president announced that France was ready to train Ukrainian fighter pilots.

title: 'War Pony' directors: 'We did not want to show a miserable image of Pine Ridge'
description: The filmmaking duo Riley Keough and Gina Gammellcollaborated with two Native American screenwriters from the Lakota American reservation to give a voice to those who have long been voiceless.

title: As actress Adèle Haenel goes on strike, French cinema is torn between admiration and disappointment
description: Screen stars have saluted Haenel's 'courage' after she announced she will stop making movies in protest at the industry's 'complacency' towards sexual predators, but others have questioned whether stepping away is the solution.

title: Bruce Springsteen and his E Street Band charm Paris with a celebration of friendship and generosity
description: On his international tour, the American singer delivered a personal and generous marathon concert in Paris on Saturday. A second is scheduled for Monday night.

title: Tunisian authorities downplay significance of Djerba synagogue attack
description: President Kaïs Saïed has refused to describe the assault on the annual Jewish pilgrimage of Ghriba as either terrorist or anti-Semitic in nature.

title: EU approves Microsoft's $69-billion Activision takeover, deal still at risk
description: The European Commission said the commitments offered by Microsoft 'fully address the competition concerns' but the deal is still in jeopardy after UK regulators rejected it.

title: Amy Pope elected as the first woman to head the UN's migration agency
description: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) tweeted on Monday that the US candidate had been elected as the next director general.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky meets Sunak as UK pledges more weapons
description: The Ukrainian president was in Britain on Monday to meet with the UK prime minister, who promised to supply hundreds more missiles and drones – a pledge Russian views very negatively.

title: Italian Open tennis: World number one Alcaraz knocked out in shock defeat
description: The Spaniard crashed out of the third round in two straight sets against 135th seed Fabian Marozsan.

title: Indian National Congress, the party of the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty, bounces back in crucial state
description: Legislative elections in the southwestern state of Karnataka, one of India's richest, were a failure for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who was heavily involved in the campaign.

title: Choose France summit: 2023 edition sees record harvest of foreign investments
description: France will announce it is receiving €13 billion in foreign investments, as 200 business leaders gather Monday around Emmanuel Macron.

title: Uber Files: former Socialist ministers defend their action against Uber's 'total cynicism'
description: Two former prime ministers were among those invited to speak to the parliamentary investigative committee looking into how the ride-hailing company established itself in the French market.

title: Kremlin slams Macron comments over Russia's 'subservience' to China
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said in an interview Sunday that Russia has 'entered a form of subservience with regards to China.'

title: Sinan Ogan, the unexpected kingmaker in Turkey's presidential election
description: The leader of a small ultranationalist party won 5.3% of the vote in the first round, and could help tip the scale in the runoff.

title: Turkey elections: Erdogan in strong position ahead of likely second round
description: Incumbent Recep Tayyip Erdogan came out on top over Kemal Kiliçdaroglu, contrary to opinion polls in the run-up to the election, and is in a strong position to win a third term.

title: Zelensky prepares for counteroffensive with tour of European capitals
description: While the Ukrainian president has new arms deliveries on the way following his European tour, he is yet to convince France or Germany to supply combat planes.

title: Vice Media files for bankruptcy protection ahead of sale
description: The news organization filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the United States. It said it continues to plan producing journalism.

title: Battery 'gigafactories' are flourishing across Europe
description: Driven by its decision to ban the sale of combustion engines after 2035, Europe is catching up in terms of battery production. But there is already a risk of overcapacity.

title: Macron and Musk to meet ahead of investment conference
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will meet the owner of Twitter and Tesla on Monday, while the billionaire is in town along with 200 foreign business leaders for the 'Choose France' summit.

title: Thailand elections: Opposition party comes out on top, in blow to military
description: The Move Forward Party became the leading political force in the kingdom after the elections of May 14, and plans ambitious reforms.

title: China sentences US citizen to life in prison on spying charges
description: A 78-year-old American residing in Hong Kong was found guilty of espionage. Few details were made public about the charges.

title: Turkey elections: In Ankara, Erdogan's supporters celebrate like winners
description: After a tense start to the election night, supporters of the incumbent president were relieved on Sunday night. Although their leader fell short of the 50% mark required to win, he has a comfortable lead.

title: War in Ukraine: Kherson, the city of hidden children
description: In the southern Ukrainian city occupied by the Russians for nine months, staff at various shelters for children in distress did everything they could to help the young residents escape from forced transfers to Russia.

title: The ghosts of the Nakba return to Israel
description: On May 15, Palestinians will commemorate the 75th anniversary of the Nakba, the 'catastrophe,' which was for them the 1948 creation of the state of Israel. Israeli documentarians are trying to record the violent acts perpetrated by Jewish troops.

title: Tariq Ramadan stands trial in Geneva for rape and sexual coercion
description: The Islamic scholar is accused of assaulting a woman in a hotel in Geneva in 2008. He is also facing four other similar cases in France.

title: In France, pressure mounts for the government to present a sustainable food transition strategy
description: While civil society is calling for an ambitious national policy to improve access to sustainable food for all, some economic stakeholders resist new constraints. The strategy is meant to be presented by the government this summer.

title: Election day in Turkey: 'People are tired of the prevailing aggressiveness, we need something else'
description: Turkish voters are divided between supporting the long-standing incumbent president Recep Tayyip Erdogan or opting for a change in leadership.

title: NBA Playoffs: The Celtics win game seven to eliminate the 76ers and advance to the Eastern Conference finals
description: Jayson Tatum's historic performance helped Boston comfortably defeat Philadelphia 112-88. The Celtics face the Miami Heat in the Eastern Conference finals with an NBA Finals berth on the line.
